IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: FRANKLIN COLLEGE SHALL ATTAIN EXCELLENCE AS A LIBERAL ARTS TEACHING AND LEARNING UNDERGRADUATE COMMUNITY. THE COLLEGE SHALL MOTIVATE AND PREPARE ITS GRADUATES FOR LIVES OF EXCELLENCE, LEADERSHIP, & SERVICE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: FRANKLIN COLLEGE SHALL ATTAIN EXCELLENCE AS A PERSONAL, PARTICIPATORY, VALUES-FOCUSED, CAREER-SENSITIVE, LIBERAL ARTS TEACHING AND LEARNING UNDERGRADUATE COMMUNITY. THE COLLEGE SHALL MOTIVATE AND PREPARE ITS GRADUATES FOR PRODUCTIVE AND SATISFYING LIVES OF EXCELLENCE, LEADERSHIP AND SERVICE.
IRS990.Description: INSTRUCTION - DESIGNING AND DELIVERING THE ACADEMIC CURRICULUM FOR UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS.

Activity2.Description: STUDENT SERVICES - ACTIVITIES RELATED TO STUDENTS' LIVES OUTSIDE THE CLASSROOM. THIS INCLUDES, STUDENT AFFAIRS, RESIDENCE LIFE, COLLEGE CHAPLAIN, ADMISSIONS, FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, ACADEMIC RECORDS, AND ATHLETICS.

Activity3.Description: SCHOLARSHIPS - GRANTS TO STUDENTS TO REDUCE STUDENTS' COST OF ATTENDANCE.

Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: VICE PRESIDENT FOR PLANNING, PLANT & TECHNOLOGY

OtherLiabilities.Description: LIABILITIES UNDER CHARITABLE ANNUITY AND UNITRUST AGREEMENTS
ADVANCES FROM FEDERAL AGENCY FOR STUDENT LOANS

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Collections of art - description of collections
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: COLLECTIONS FROM VARIOUS SCHOLARS, DIGNITARIES, AND ARTISTS ENHANCE THE INTELLECTUAL ATMOSPHERE ON CAMPUS.
THE ENDOWMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT FOR THE OPERATION OF THE COLLEGE AND HELPS THE COLLEGE FULFILL ITS MISSION BY PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FACULTY SUPPORT.

THE COLLEGE IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE UNITED STATES INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE COLLEGE IS NOT CONSIDERED TO BE A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. CURRENT ACCOUNT STANDARDS REQUIRE THE COLLEGE TO DISCLOSE THE AMOUNT OF POTENTIAL BENEFIT OR OBLIGATION TO BE REALIZED AS A RESULT OF AN EXAMINATION PERFORMED BY A TAXING AUTHORITY. FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2010 AND 2009, MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE COLLEGE DOES NOT HAVE ANY TAX POSITIONS THAT RESULT IN ANY UNCERTAINTIES REGARDING THE POSSIBLE IMPACT ON THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE COLLEGE DOES NOT EXPECT THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS TO SIGNIFICANTLY CHANGE IN THE NEXT 12 MONTHS. THE COLLEGE IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES IN FOR YEARS BEFORE 2007. THE COLLEGE RECOGNIZES INTEREST AND/OR PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAX MATTERS IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE. THE COLLEGE DID NOT HAVE ANY AMOUNTS ACCRUED FOR INTEREST AND PENALTIES AT JUNE 30, 2010.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Other expenses in form 990 not in audited financial statements

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: FRANKLIN COLLEGE IS COMMITTED TO A POLICY OF NONDISCRIMINATION ON THE BASIS OF AGE, COLOR, DISABILITY, RACE, RELIGION, GENDER, NATIONAL ORIGIN, AND SEXUAL ORIENTATION IN ANY OF ITS PROGRAMS AND OFFERINGS IN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IX OF THE FEDERAL EDUCATIONAL AMENDMENTS OF 1972, OF EXECUTIVE ORDER 11246 AND REVISED ORDER NO. 4 OF THE CIVIL RIGHTS ACT OF 1964 AS AMENDED IN 1972 AND SECTION 504 OF THE REHABILITATION ACT OF 1973. FRANKLIN COLLEGE POSTS THE NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY ON ITS WEBSITE ON WEB PAGES DESIGNED FOR PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS AND ADMITTED STUDENTS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE OPERATE TOGETHER TO ENSURE GRANTS ARE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AFTER THE GRANTS ARE APPROVED AND DISBURSED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: Housing allowance or residence for personal use
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE PRESIDENT IS REQUIRED TO RESIDE IN THE PRESIDENT'S HOME AS PART OF HIS DUTIES AS PRESIDENT. BECAUSE THIS IS REQUIRED OF HIM AS PART OF HIS EMPLOYMENT, THIS IS NOT TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: Health or social club dues or initiation fees
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: CLUB DUES ARE PAID FOR THE PRESIDENT, VICE PRESIDENT FOR INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT, VICE PRESIDENT FOR ENROLLMENT, AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ACADEMIC AFFAIRS. ALL ARE TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION AND APPEAR ON THE FORMS W-2 FOR THESE INDIVIDUALS.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: Written policy regarding payment or reimbursement of expenses
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE BENEFITS FOR THE PRESIDENT. THE PRESIDENT DOES SO FOR ALL OTHER STAFF/FACULTY POSITIONS.
JAMES G. MOSELEY, PRESIDENT, PARTICIPATED IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN. HE DEFERRED $25,000 DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: EXPANSION OF CAMPUS CENTER AND REFUNDING OF 10/7/1999 BOND ISSUE

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: OWNED BY TRUSTEE JOHN AULD, JR.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Third parties used to solicit, process, or sell noncash contributions
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: FRANKLIN COLLEGE HAS ACCOUNTS AT BROKERAGE HOUSES INTO WHICH DONORS MAY TRANSFER SECURITIES. EACH OF THESE BROKERAGES ARE INSTRUCTED TO SELL ALL SECURITIES THAT ARE RECEIVED AT THEIR EARLIEST OPPORTUNITY PER FRANKLIN'S GIFT POLICY. NONE OF THESE BROKERAGE HOUSES SOLICIT NON-CASH CONTRIBUTIONS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: SUSAN DEVOSS AND ROBERT DEVOSS - FAMILY RELATIONSHIP;

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Review of form 990 by governing body
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. THEN A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO EVERY MEMBER OF THE GOVERNING BODY BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL EMPLOYEES AND TRUSTEES ANNUALLY SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT. THE PRESIDENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING THE STATEMENTS FOR COLLEGE EMPLOYEES. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING THE STATEMENTS OF THE TRUSTEES AND THE PRESIDENT. ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THAT ARE DISCLOSED ARE REPORTED TO THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD WHO ENSURES THE INDIVIDUAL ABSTAINS FROM VOTING ON MATTERS RELATED TO THE CONFLICT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Process used to establish compensation of top management official
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE PRESIDENT'S COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ESTABLISHES THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION ANNUALLY. THIS IS DONE THROUGH A REVIEW PROCESS BY WHICH THE PRESIDENT'S PERFORMANCE IS ASSESSED. THE COMMITTEE USES COMPARATIVE SALARY DATA, INCLUDING FORMS 990 OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, TO MAKE ITS FINAL DECISION. THE DECISION IS THEN RECOMMENDED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE BOARD THEN VOTES ON THE MATTER. THE DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2009.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATIONS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Financial aid or assistance from a governmental agency
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION DOES RECEIVE ASSISTANCE FROM A GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PROCESS USED TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE PRESIDENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING THE COMPENSATION FOR ALL EMPLOYEES AND OTHER OFFICERS OF THE COLLEGE. THIS IS DONE ANNUALLY. THE PRESIDENT USES COMPARABILITY DATA TO ESTABLISH THE COMPENSATION. THE DELIBERATION AND DECISIONS ARE DOCUMENTED. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2009.
PROCEEDS USED FOR ISSUANCE COSTS - $191,641 PROCEEDS USED FOR CREDIT ENHANCEMENT - $54,690 TOTAL - $246,331
